title: Nettskjema Attachments: Download and Save
text: Nettskjema allows users upload attachments form submissions. vignette explains use functions provided package list, retrieve, save attachments efficiently.

title: Nettskjema Attachments: Download and Save
text: downloading attachments, ’s useful list available files.

what: Listing attachments for a specific submission
title: Nettskjema Attachments: Download and Save
text: submission ID may associated attachments. Use ns_list_submission_attachments() retrieve information available attachments. function returns data.frame details attachment ID, original filename, standardized filename.
code: library(nettskjemar) # Example: List attachments for a specific submission submission_id <- 27685292 ns_list_submission_attachments(submission_id) #>   submissionId  answerId elementId externalElementId #> 1     27685292 158263134   1641713      attachment_1 #>   textAnswer answerAttachmentId  filename mediaType #> 1  sølvi.png             538819 sølvi.png image/png #>     size elementType attachment.answerAttachmentId #> 1 628613  ATTACHMENT                        538819 #>   attachment.filename attachment.mediaType #> 1           sølvi.png            image/png #>   attachment.size counter #> 1          628613       1

what: Listing all attachments for a form
title: Nettskjema Attachments: Download and Save
text: list attachments across multiple submissions form, use ns_list_form_attachments().
code: # Example: List attachments for an entire form formid <- 123823 ns_list_form_attachments(formid) #>    formid formId submissionId  answerId elementId #> 16 123823 123823     27685292 158263134   1641713 #> 32 123823 123823     27685302 158263185   3525020 #>    externalElementId  textAnswer answerOptionIds #> 16      attachment_1   sølvi.png                 #> 32      attachment_2 marius.jpeg                 #>    externalAnswerOptionIds elementType #> 16                          ATTACHMENT #> 32                          ATTACHMENT #>            createdDate        modifiedDate #> 16 2023-06-01T20:57:15 2023-06-01T20:57:15 #> 32 2023-06-01T20:58:33 2023-06-01T20:58:33 #>    subElementId answerAttachmentId    filename #> 16           NA             538819   sølvi.png #> 32           NA             538820 marius.jpeg #>     mediaType   size attachment.answerAttachmentId #> 16  image/png 628613                        538819 #> 32 image/jpeg  89494                        538820 #>    attachment.filename attachment.mediaType #> 16           sølvi.png            image/png #> 32         marius.jpeg           image/jpeg #>    attachment.size counter #> 16          628613       1 #> 32           89494       1

title: Nettskjema Attachments: Download and Save
text: identified attachments, can download using ns_get_attachment(). path provided, function returns response object without saving file.
code: # Example: Download a single attachment attachment_id <- "12345" ns_get_attachment(attachment_id, path = "downloaded_file.pdf")

title: Nettskjema Attachments: Download and Save
text: Use ns_get_submission_attachments() download save attachments associated single submission. function supports two filename conventions: “standardized” (default): Creates filenames based submission ID counter. “original”: Uses filenames uploaded. save attachments using original filenames: can also specify output directory:
code: # Example: Save all attachments for a submission ns_get_submission_attachments(submission_id) ns_get_submission_attachments(submission_id, filenames = "original") ns_get_submission_attachments(submission_id, output_dir = "my_attachments/")

title: Nettskjema Attachments: Download and Save
text: download save attachments form: submission attachments, can specify filename format output directory:
code: ns_get_form_attachments(formid) ns_get_form_attachments(formid, filenames = "original", output_dir = "all_attachments/")

title: Nettskjema Attachments: Download and Save
text: vignette demonstrated : - List attachments submissions forms. - Retrieve individual attachments. - Save attachments using different naming conventions. using functions, can efficiently manage Nettskjema file attachments within R workflow.

title: Authentication Setup for Nettskjema API
text: using functions, need following: 1. registered API client Nettskjema. 2. client credentials (client ID client secret). provided register client. register client go nettskjema API page use ns_create_client() function open url. asked log user account, can create client.

title: Authentication Setup for Nettskjema API
text: prevent hardcoding credentials scripts, add following entries .Renviron file. .Renviron file hidden file home directory R reads startup. Open .Renviron file. can create edit : Add credentials: Replace your_client_id your_client_secret actual values received Nettskjema. Save close file. Restart R session load changes.
code: file.edit(fs::path_home(".Renviron")) NETTSKJEMA_CLIENT_ID=your_client_id NETTSKJEMA_CLIENT_SECRET=your_client_secret

title: Authentication Setup for Nettskjema API
text: Use ns_auth_token function retrieve access token. function exchanges client credentials valid token. token cached default efficiency. returns list objects, successfully retrieved token Nettskjema can use remaining functions package. default, token stored home directory .nettskjema_token.rds 24-hour validity period (max validity token). token automatically refreshed 24–hour period , user even notice happens. can configure caching path using cache_path argument function, comfortable .
code: library(nettskjemar)  # Try getting your user information ns_get_me() #> $isPersonalDataResponsible #> [1] FALSE #>  #> $displayName #> [1] "athanasm@uio.no" #>  #> $logoutLink #> [1] "/signout" #>  #> $isSuperUser #> [1] FALSE #>  #> $isAuthenticated #> [1] TRUE #>  #> $userType #> [1] "FEIDE_USER" #>  #> $hasAcceptedTos #> [1] TRUE #>  #> $isSupportUser #> [1] FALSE #>  #> $isAdministrativeUser #> [1] TRUE #>  #> $isInLdapGroupUioTils #> [1] TRUE

title: Authentication Setup for Nettskjema API
text: Invalid Credentials: Ensure client ID client secret correct properly registered Nettskjema. Token Expiry: Tokens valid 24 hours default. Re-run ns_auth_token refresh token. Environment Variables Loaded: Ensure ’ve added credentials .Renviron restarted R session.

title: Authentication Setup for Nettskjema API
text: can find information Nettskjema v3 API official UiO documentation pages.

title: Fetching Information on Forms
text: prefer get raw list format returned API, use asis = TRUE.
code: # Retrieve raw form data raw_forms <- ns_get_forms(asis = TRUE)  # Display the raw response print(raw_forms)

title: Fetching Information on Forms
text: form can reports CSV, Excel, SPSS files associated . Use ns_get_form_reports function download reports.

title: Fetching Information on Forms
code: # Define the form ID form_id <- 110000  # Download a CSV report to the default path ns_get_form_reports(form_id, type = "csv")  # The report will be saved as `110000.csv` in your working directory

title: Fetching Information on Forms
code: # Download an Excel report ns_get_form_reports(form_id, type = "excel")

what: Example: Save SPSS Report to a Custom Path
title: Fetching Information on Forms
code: # Specify the path you want to save the file path <- fs::path_home("Desktop/110000_report.sav")  # Download and save the SPSS report ns_get_form_reports(form_id, type = "spss", path = path)

title: Fetching Information on Forms
text: custom output locations, make sure provide full file path path argument.

title: Enhanced Workflow with Labelled Data
text: Labelled data type dataset variables values contain additional metadata. datasets, common tools like SPSS Stata, allow better understanding documentation variables. haven package R specifically designed working datasets. enhances metadata handling allowing embed variable value labels directly data. vignette, ’ll explore labelled data works, leveraging key haven package functionalities extract, inspect, manipulate labels.

title: Enhanced Workflow with Labelled Data
text: example data, displayed standard data.frame. nothing particularly special . continue, also need download form codebook, need add labels. add labels, use ns_add_labels function, using unlabelled data codebook. notice surface look completely normal, added extras. Inspecting data str function however expose lies beneath surface. can see lots label attributes attached lab_data data object. labels attached codebook, provide important context data source actually . hidden features data unlocked working functions {haven} package. Notice metadata (variable value labels) now embedded dataset.
code:
library(nettskjemar) # Replace this with your form ID formid <- 123823 data <- ns_get_data(formid) data #> formid $submission_id $created #> 1 123823 27685292 2023-06-01T20:57:15+02:00 #> freetext radio checkbox.questionnaires #> 1 some text 1 1 #> checkbox.events checkbox.logs dropdown #> 1 1 0 4 #> radio_matrix.grants radio_matrix.lecture #> 1 1 2 #> radio_matrix.email checkbox_matrix.1.IT #> 1 2 1 #> checkbox_matrix.1.colleague #> 1 1 #> checkbox_matrix.1.admin checkbox_matrix.1.union #> 1 0 0 #> checkbox_matrix.1.internet checkbox_matrix.2.IT #> 1 0 0 #> checkbox_matrix.2.colleague #> 1 0 #> checkbox_matrix.2.admin checkbox_matrix.2.union #> 1 1 0 #> checkbox_matrix.2.internet date time #> 1 0 2023-06-01 12:00 #> datetime number_decimal number_integer #> 1 2023-06-12T13:33 4.5 77 #> slider attachment_1 attachment_2 $answer_time_ms #> 1 3 sølvi.png 74630 #> [ reached 'max' / getOption("max.print") -- omitted 2 rows ] cb <- ns_get_codebook(formid) cb #> element_no element_type element_code #> 1 1 HEADING #> 2 2 TEXT #> 3 3 IMAGE #> 4 4 PAGE_BREAK #> 5 5 QUESTION freetext #> element_text #> 1 Let talk about Nettskjema! title: Enhanced Workflow with Labelled Data
